I think that would be a fair decision to make. It'll probably cover the vast majority of cases as it is almost universal to use a byte with value 0/1 to represent `bool`. Here's a few examples of standard libraries using that particular encoding format:

* [Java's `DataOutputStream` class][java]
* [Python's `struct` package][python]
* [C#'s `BinaryWriter` class][csharp]

[java]: https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/io/DataOutputStream.html#writeBoolean(boolean)
[python]: https://docs.python.org/3/library/struct.html#format-characters
[csharp]: https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/91xey4hy(v=vs.110).aspx
